publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-695 Sandra White: Changing Lives—That the Parliament congratulates Robert Keys, from Glasgow, on his award as winner of the ProjectScotland Volunteer of the Year award in the arts and culture category; notes that Robert has overcome a number of difficulties and challenges in his life to become a great example and positive role model for other disadvantaged youngsters, and acknowledges the positive work done by ProjectScotland and other voluntary service organisations in helping those previously excluded from participating fully in society to realise their true potential and aspirations.

S3M-695 Sandra White: Changing Lives—That the Parliament congratulates Robert Keys, from Glasgow, on his award as winner of the ProjectScotland Volunteer of the Year award in the arts and culture category; notes that Robert has overcome a number of difficulties and challenges in his life to become a great example and positive role model for other disadvantaged youngsters, and acknowledges the positive work done by ProjectScotland and other voluntary service organisations in helping those previously excluded from participating fully in society to realise their true potential and aspirations.

S3M-695 Changing Lives (lodged on 25 October 2007) Rob Gibson*, Alex Neil*, Bob Doris*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Kenneth Gibson*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Bill Kidd*, Elaine Smith*, Bashir Ahmad*, Jamie Hepburn*, Stuart McMillan*
S3M-695 Changing Lives (lodged on 25 October 2007) Malcolm Chisholm*
S3M-695 Changing Lives (lodged on 25 October 2007) Hugh Henry*
S3M-695 Changing Lives (lodged on 25 October 2007) Robin Harper*
S3M-695 Changing Lives (lodged on 25 October 2007) Jack McConnell*, Patrick Harvie*
S3M-695 Changing Lives (lodged on 25 October 2007) Ms Wendy Alexander*
S3M-695 Changing Lives (lodged on 25 October 2007) Bill Butler* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
